title: Halloumi burger with red onion jam
strInstructions: Red onion marmalade: Peel and slice the onion and fry it slowly in the butter with finely chopped garlic. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer slowly until the liquid has boiled. Divide the halloumi into two halves. Grill or fry the halloumi to a nice color. Slice the tomato, grill or toast the breads. Combine burgers with bread, salad, tomato, halloumi and red onion jam.

title: Pizza pie with milled squash and herbs

Ingredients: 1 finished pizza dough, eg for sourdough pizza (400 g)
Filling: 1 dl chopped mixed fresh herbs, eg fresh basil
parsley and fresh thyme: 1 dl grated aged cheese, 31%, eg Västerbotten cheese

strInstructions: . Set the oven to 220 °. Grease a round, low and pleated pie tin with oil. Pull out the dough (if it is not already rolled out) with lightly floured fingers to a round dough plate, which is slightly larger than the mold. Put the dough in the mold so that the dough goes up on the edge. Filling: Divide the squash lengthwise into four. Cut the lengths into slices. Peel a squash, grate it and squeeze the juice. Peel and finely chop the garlic. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Fry squash and red onion until softened and slightly colored. Add the garlic and remove from the heat. Turn the herbs over and season with salt and pepper. Whisk the cream cheese with the egg yolk. Spread on the pizza dough in the mold. Sprinkle over the stored cheese. 4. Distribute the vegetables in the mold and sprinkle over the mozzarella. Bake in the middle of the oven for 15-20 minutes. Drizzle over a little oil and garnish with basil leaves.
